name: paraphrastically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in the form of a paraphrase (= the same thing written or spoken using different words): In English, the verb is often translated paraphrastically. The work was translated into Greek, then into Latin, and translated back, often rather paraphrastically, into Hebrew.
More examplesFewer examplesThe idea has been conveyed paraphrastically into popular culture.The phrase is usually translated paraphrastically as "to be able".In order to convey the full sense, I have expressed it somewhat paraphrastically.Some individual words are dealt with more paraphrastically.
